author: wtopstaff
title: Monday’s Sports Transactions
text:
Home » News » Sports » Monday's Sports Transactions Monday’s Sports Transactions By The Associated Press October 12, 2015 3:00 pm BASEBALL National League 
NEW YORK METS — Selected the contract of INF Matt Reynolds from Las Vegas (PCL) and added him to the NLDS roster. Removed INF Ruben Tejada from the NLDS roster. Designated RHP Tim Stauffer for reassignment. 
WASHINGTON NATIONALS — Named Randy Knorr senior assistant to the general manager-player development, Bobby Henley senior advisor-player development and Matt Lecroy manager for Harrisburg (EL). Promoted Brian Daubach to hitting coach for Syracuse (IL). FOOTBALL 
BUFFALO BILLS — Activated DE IK Enemkpali. Placed RB Cierre Wood on injured reserve. 
INDIANAPOLIS COLTS — Signed KR-PR Marcus Thigpen. Released QB Josh Johnson. 
MIAMI DOLPHINS — Promoted Darren Rizzi to assistant head coach/special teams coordinator. HOCKEY 
NEW JERSEY DEVILS — Reassigned G Ken Appleby from Adirondack (ECHL) to Albany (AHL). SOCCER 
TORONTO FC — Named Bill Manning president. COLLEGE 
CENTRAL FLORIDA — Announced football coach George O’Leary relinquished his job as the school’s interim athletic director. 
FLORIDA — Suspended freshman QB Will Grier indefinitely for violating the NCAA’s policy on banned drugs. Topics:
